summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing how to handle Touhy requests (requests for government information in third-party litigation) related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails focus on coordinating responses to requests from victims in civil suits, determining which office has responsibility for materials from the Southern District of Florida investigation, and establishing procedures for handling such requests.

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: Primary point person for handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims in civil litigation; drafts response letters and coordinates with criminal AUSAs.

persons.name: John McEnany
persons.context: Provides legal guidance on Touhy regulations and procedures; consulted on handling requests for materials from the Southern District of Florida investigation.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Criminal AUSA involved in Epstein case; works with Steven Kochevar on Touhy requests, particularly regarding access to investigative materials and communication with victim's counsel.

persons.name: David Jones
persons.context: Mentioned as having thought a proposed approach to a Touhy request was reasonable.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: Referred to as a 'wiser Touhy head' in the Civil Division to be consulted on jurisdictional issues.

persons.name: Maria Lacerda
persons.context: Identified as 'Jane Doe,' a victim who is a plaintiff in a civil suit against Epstein's estate and submitted a Touhy request for documents.

persons.name: Robbie Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP representing an Epstein victim in civil litigation; recipient of initial Touhy procedure letter from the USAO.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and central figure in the criminal investigation and related civil litigation; subject of the Touhy requests.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Mentioned as having signed off on a response letter and document production for a Touhy request.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned as having signed off on a response letter and document production for a Touhy request.

persons.name: Jeffrey 0
persons.context: Mentioned in passing as someone John McEnany spoke to about continuing to use Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Touhy requests.

persons.name: Rossmiller
persons.context: Mentioned in draft language as the initial recipient of a request for information, to be handled by another AUSA.

connections.description: Collaborating on legal strategy and procedures for responding to Touhy requests related to the Epstein case.
Working together, with Kochevar handling external communications and Alex providing criminal case knowledge, to address victim requests.
Kaplan is the attorney representing victim Maria Lacerda in her civil suit against Epstein's estate.
Kochevar, representing the USAO, corresponds with Kaplan, the plaintiff's attorney, regarding Touhy request procedures.
McEnany consulted with Jeffrey 0 regarding designating Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Touhy requests.

events.title: Production of Documents to Epstein Victim
events.description: The USAO-SDNY produced documents responsive to a Touhy request from an Epstein victim (Maria Lacerda) who is a plaintiff in a civil suit.

events.title: Discussion on Jurisdiction for SDFla Materials
events.description: AUSA John McEnany expresses hesitation about referring a Touhy requester to the Northern District of Georgia for materials from the Southern District of Florida's Epstein investigation, citing jurisdictional regulations.

events.title: Establishment of Touhy Request Protocol
events.description: AUSA Alex memorializes an agreement that Steven Kochevar will be the point person for Touhy requests from Epstein victims in civil litigation, with support from criminal AUSAs.

keyFacts: The USAO-SDNY was actively handling Touhy requests from victims of Jeffrey Epstein who were plaintiffs in civil litigation against his estate.

There was internal debate about which U.S. Attorney's Office had responsibility for materials from the closed Southern District of Florida Epstein investigation, with the Northern District of Georgia having potentially taken over that role.
The document reveals the victim 'Jane Doe' was specifically identified as Maria Lacerda.
The emails show coordination between Civil and Criminal Division AUSAs to manage external information requests while protecting ongoing investigations and sensitive law enforcement information.
A standard procedural letter detailing Touhy regulations was used to inform requesters of the formal process for obtaining government information.
